data: Restricted to Department of Palliative Care
Initiate these orders if patient exhibits seizure activity lasting more than 5 minutes
Please Refer to Onset of Seizure Algorism
Nurse must accompany patient off ward for tests and procedures if patient actively seizuring or has seizured within the last 12 hours
Patient Safety: Seizure pads and functioning seizure emergency equipment at bedside (oxygen, suction, face mask and oral airway)

Seizure Management: Call for help, stay with patient, ABC's, monitor sats, ensure airway is in alignment with body
Post Seizure: Turn patient on side to facilitate drainage of secretions
If known seizure disorder and patient experiencing seizure activity that last no more than 5 minutes, observe patient only
Inform physician of seizure activity (if not already aware)
Contact most responsible physician if patient exhibits any of the following: Anxiety, restlessness, pale skin, diaphoresis, decreasing level of consciousness and IV site problems
T;N, Dry weight for drug calculations in kg
q30min x 1 h, q1h x 2 hours, q4h x 24 hours, then qshift (if no further seizures)
q30min x 1 h, q1h x 2 hours, q4h x 24 hours, then qshift (if no further seizures)
q30min x 1 h, q1h x 2 hours, q4h x 24 hours, then qshift (if no further seizures)
q30min x 1 h, q1h x 2 hours, q4h x 24 hours, then qshift (if no further seizures)
q30min x 1 h, q1h x 2 hours, q4h x 24 hours, then qshift (if no further seizures)
q30min x 1 h, q1h x 2 hours, q4h x 24 hours, then qshift (if no further seizures)
Administer the following medications STAT: LORazepam or midazolam
mg, IV, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
mg, subcutaneous, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
mg, IV, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
mg, subcutaneous, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
If seizure activity continues, repeat LORazepam or midazolam as necessary. Call Provider for management orders AND administer next intervention
mg, IV, PRN seizure activity, doses or times, drug form: inj
mg, subcutaneous, PRN seizure activity, doses or times, drug form: inj
mg, IV, PRN seizure activity, doses or times, drug form: inj
mg, subcutaneous, PRN seizure activity, doses or times, drug form: inj
If seizure activity persists and patient not currently on phenytoin, call Provider before initiating phenytoin
15 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: bag, first does: Now
100 mg, IV, q8h, drug form: bag
mg, IV, q8h, drug form: bag
300 mg, PO, daily, drug form: cap
mg, PO, daily, drug form: cap
T;N+2, Draw Peak phenytoin level and albumin 2 hours after loading dose
Draw Trough phenytoin level prior to the 5th maintenance dose
Liver function tests (Bilirubin, ALP, Alb, ALT, GGT)
T;N, once, Draw after seizure activity subsides
Titrate O2 to keep O2 SpO2 92% or greater
Titrate O2 to keep O2 SpO2 88-92% for COPD patients
